private_information: You can move only disks A, B, C, D, E
You must follow Tower of Hanoi rules and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
You operate on pegs named left, middle, right
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves for your authorized disks that lead from the initial configuration to the specified goal configuration, using the required primitive move format.

private_information: You can move only disks F, G, H, I, J
You must follow Tower of Hanoi rules and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
You operate on pegs named left, middle, right
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves for your authorized disks that lead from the initial configuration to the specified goal configuration, using the required primitive move format.

private_information: You can move only disks K, L, M, N, O
You must follow Tower of Hanoi rules and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
You operate on pegs named left, middle, right
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves for your authorized disks that lead from the initial configuration to the specified goal configuration, using the required primitive move format.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed move sequences
You remove bookkeeping shortcuts, quota tokens, or any non-primitive abstractions and ensure every move is applicable at its step
You ensure agent authority constraints and Tower of Hanoi legality at every step
auditor.goal: Validate and, if needed, correct the combined move list to ensure strict legality and causal soundness, then produce an audited final list.

private_information: You coordinate agents, resolve conflicts, and finalize outputs
You must produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver, and the consolidated ordered list of primitive moves
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' proposals and the audit into a single, correct sequence of primitive moves and provide a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward that encode the same initial and goal configurations.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agents are constrained to move only specific disks: agent_1 can move A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 can move F, G, H, I, J; agent_3 can move K, L, M, N, O.
A legal move transfers the top disk of a peg to the top of another peg and never places a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) B; right peg has (top->bottom) C, D.
Primitive move format: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
Only the topmost disk of any peg may be moved at any time.
reference_solution: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi planner. Propose a legal ordered sequence of primitive moves strictly limited to your authorized disks and respecting all Tower of Hanoi rules and the given initial and goal configurations.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private info: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Propose only moves for disks A, B, C, D, E in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not propose moves for disks outside your authority and do not use shortcuts.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi planner. Propose a legal ordered sequence of primitive moves strictly limited to your authorized disks and respecting all Tower of Hanoi rules and the given initial and goal configurations.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private info: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Propose only moves for disks F, G, H, I, J in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no moves are required for your disks, explicitly state that and provide an empty move list.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are a cooperative Tower of Hanoi planner. Propose a legal ordered sequence of primitive moves strictly limited to your authorized disks and respecting all Tower of Hanoi rules and the given initial and goal configurations.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private info: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Propose only moves for disks K, L, M, N, O in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no moves are required for your disks, explicitly state that and provide an empty move list.

audit.system_prompt: You are a rigorous temporal and causal auditor. You check that each proposed move is applicable given the exact preceding state, that no move violates Tower of Hanoi constraints, and that each move is performed by an agent authorized to move that disk. You remove any bookkeeping shortcuts or non-primitive abstractions and ensure the final list is minimal with respect to the chosen subgoals when possible.
audit.prompt: Audit the combined proposals from agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and the initial and goal states {environment->init}. Verify agent authority constraints, top-of-peg preconditions, and size ordering at every step. Output a brief audit summary and an 'audited_moves' list in the primitive format, ready for execution.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent coordinator and PDDL modeler. Produce a final consolidated ordered list of primitive moves that respects agent authority and Tower of Hanoi rules, and generate a PDDL domain and problem that target the FastDownward solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use classical PDDL with types (disk, peg), static smaller relations over disks, predicates for on(x,y), onpeg(x,p), clear(x) for disks and clearpeg(p) or top-of-peg encoding, and actions that move a clear top disk between pegs while respecting smaller constraints. In the problem file, declare objects A through O and pegs left, middle, right; encode the exact initial configuration and the exact goal configuration specified in the public information. Avoid quantifiers if possible and keep the model FastDownward-friendly.
pddl.prompt: Coordinate the multi-agent plan to reach the goal. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Inputs from agents: {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, {moves_agent_3}. Auditor report: {audit_report}. First, provide the final consolidated 'Ordered primitive move list' obeying the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Then provide the PDDL domain and problem enclosed in the required tags. Ensure the PDDL matches the initial and goal states in {environment->init} and is compatible with FastDownward.
